summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Parks, Trails, and the Environment Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on December 4, 2023, at 9:00 AM, both in-person at City Hall and via video conference. The meeting aims to discuss various environmental initiatives and updates relevant to the city's parks and sustainability efforts.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the November 6, 2023, committee meeting.
2. Presentation of the Comprehensive Environment & Climate Action Plan (CECAP) Annual Report.
3. Update on the economic value of parks.
4. Discussion of the Dallas Environmental Education Initiative (EEI) Interlocal Agreement.
5. Update on the remediation of the Former Blue Star Site.
6. Review of the Office of Environmental Quality & Sustainability's 2025 State and Federal Legislative Priorities.
7. Environmental Commission update.

**Important Details**:  
The CECAP Annual Report will provide insights into the city's sustainability progress. The Parks Economic Value Update will highlight the financial benefits of parks to the community. The EEI Interlocal Agreement aims to enhance environmental education efforts. The Former Blue Star Site remediation update will address ongoing environmental restoration efforts.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and discuss the adoption of the EEI Interlocal Agreement. Additionally, the committee will review and potentially endorse the legislative priorities for the Office of Environmental Quality & Sustainability for 2025.
